answers.answer: All of those are signs of preeclampsia so you should seek medical help as soon as possible. I would say go to the ER. At the least it could just be caused by high blood pressure. I had the same symptoms and was sent to the ER. Fortunately is was just high bp and was prescribed meds to help control it, but I am now labeled high risk because of the elevated bp and increased risk of developing preeclampsia later. I would say go to the ER. Better to be safe than sorry!
Yes all those thing are normal :D I've been going through all those things since I turned 20 weeks !
Hope it's not preeclampsia. My last appt my blood pressure was fine. Unfortunately I have to wait to go to the doctor, so I'm hoping I'll be fine.
Bump ? Anyone else have these symptoms without it being preeclampsia or anything else too serious?

You need to drink ALOT more water.  That will help with the blurry vision, headaches and cramping. They are signs of preeclampsia but Id say dehydrated most likely.  Go to walmart or a drugstore and check your blood pressure.

I have all those things and have borderline preeclampsia. See your Dr as soon as possible. Of you do develop preeclampsia it can be dangerous for you and baby. My Dr won't let me carry full term so I'm having to be induced early.

That sometimes would happen to me in my second trimester, I didn't have preeclampsia. Everyone is different though. I only got maybe a total of 3-4 bad head aches when I was in my second trimester. The blurred vision I would get it seemed if I was standing for a long time, sometimes it would come and go. And my cramps I was told was just normal growing pains. Like I said though everyone is different, I also started seeing the obgyn at 7 weeks and so on. I would just try and make an appointment for as soon as you possibly can at your new obgyn office.

question: Okay, so normally I wouldn't be worrying so much, but due to having to move, I haven't been to my OB in a month and I still have to wait to find a new one where I live now :( so if you moms could help me out with my questions I'd appreciate that! Is it normal (at 23 weeks) to:Have headaches all the time(I AM stressed lately so that could make it worse)Have swelling in my feet and ankles without being up and about that muchHave blurred vision off and on throughout the dayStill have cramps from time to time?????Sorry for ALL the questions haha but I need help! Thanks ladies .
title: Questions about Pregnancy - 2nd Trimester- FTM
